snippet: The parent company, TransCanada, seeks a delay, but some see an attempt to stall a decision on the contentious pipeline issue until a new administration takes office.
abstract: Pres Obama plans to reject TransCanada request to delay yearslong evaluation of proposed 1,179-mile Keystone XL pipeline so he can take action before leaving office; is set to announce final decision, which will be part of his larger environmental legacy, before climate change conference in Paris in December 2015.
lead_paragraph: The parent company, TransCanada, seeks a delay, but some see an attempt to stall a decision on the contentious pipeline issue until a new administration takes office.

headline.main: Obama Won’t Yield to Company’s Bid to Delay Keystone Pipeline Decision
headline.print_headline: Obama Won’t Yield to Company’s Bid to Delay Keystone Pipeline Decision
